newsitem.title: BRAZIL: RESEARCH ALERT-Cesp still a Fator buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Cesp still a Fator buy.

text.p: Fator Securities said it has maintained its buy rating on Brazilian state-owned Companhia Energetica de Sao Paulo (Cesp) but is lowering its 1997 earnings forecast for the firm after release of its first-quarter loss.
-- Fator analysts Isabel Bresser and Teresinha Moniz said Cesp's 64.8 million-real first-quarter net loss was larger than their projected 7.1 million-real loss due to increased financial costs.
-- But they added: "We are still maintaining our buy recommendation due to Cesp's upside potential after necessary adjustments are made in preparation for privatization."
-- The analysts said first-quarter net revenues of 839 million reais were 7.3 percent higher than the same period a year ago while operating costs were 2.5 percent higher.
-- Cesp common closed off 2.7 percent at 54 reais while its preferred ended off 0.57 percent at 52.50 reais in Sao Paulo.
